sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Cramer's rule
message_2:
To solve the given system of equations using Cramer's rule, we first need to find the determinant of the coefficient matrix (D), and then the determinants of the matrices obtained by replacing the columns with the constants (Dx, Dy, Dz).

The coefficient matrix is:
\[
\begin{bmatrix}
2 & 3 & -1 \\
5 & -2 & 6 \\
1 & 4 & 2
\end{bmatrix}
\]

To find the determinant D:
\[
D = 2((-2)(2) - (6)(4)) - 3((5)(2) - (6)(1)) - 1((5)(4) - (-2)(1)) \\
D = 2(-4 - 24) - 3(10 - 6) - 1(20 + 2) \\
D = 2(-28) - 3(4) - 1(22) \\
D = -56 - 12 - 22 \\
D = -90
\]

Now, we will find Dx by replacing the first column with the constants:
\[
\begin{bmatrix}
4 & 3 & -1 \\
1 & -2 & 6 \\
3 & 4 & 2
\end{bmatrix}
\]

To find the determinant Dx:
\[
Dx = 4((-2)(2) - (6)(4)) - 3((1)(2) - (6)(3)) - 1((1)(4) - (-2)(3)) \\
Dx = 4(-4 - 24) - 3(2 - 18) - 1(4 + 6) \\
Dx = 4(-28) - 3(-16) - 1(10) \\
Dx = -112 + 48 - 10 \\
Dx = -74
\]

Now, we will find Dy by replacing the second column with the constants:
\[
\begin{bmatrix}
2 & 4 & -1 \\
5 & 1 & 6 \\
1 & 3 & 2
\end{bmatrix}
\]

To find the determinant Dy:
\[
Dy = 2((1)(2) - (6)(3)) - 4((5)(2) - (6)(1)) + 1((5)(3) - (1)(1)) \\
Dy = 2(2 - 18) - 4(10 - 6) + 1(15 - 1) \\
Dy = 2(-16) - 4(4) + 1(14) \\
Dy = -32 - 16 + 14 \\
Dy = -34
\]

Finally, we will find Dz by replacing the third column with the constants:
\[
\begin{bmatrix}
2 & 3 & 4 \\
5 & -2 & 1 \\
1 & 4 & 3
\end{bmatrix}
\]

To find the determinant Dz:
\[
Dz = 2((-2)(3) - (1)(4)) - 3((5)(3) - (1)(1)) + 4((5)(4) - (-2)(1)) \\
Dz = 2(-6 - 4) - 3(15 - 1) + 4(20 + 2) \\
Dz = 2(-10) - 3(14) + 4(22) \\
Dz = -20 - 42 + 88 \\
Dz = 26
\]

Now, we can find the values of x, y, and z using the determinants:

x = Dx / D = -74 / -90 = 37/45

y = Dy / D = -34 / -90 = 17/45

z = Dz / D = 26 / -90 = -13/45

So, the solution to the system of equations is:

x = 37/45, y = 17/45, and z = -13/45.
